provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent and all persons acting with it must not make any express or implied misrepresentations about the accuracy, efficacy, comparative bias performance, or liveness detection of its Facial Recognition Technology.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition on Unsubstantiated Accuracy and Bias Claims
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make any representation about the effectiveness, accuracy, lack of bias, or spoofing detection of its Facial Recognition Technology unless it possesses and relies upon competent and reliable testing that substantiates the claim at the time it is made.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgements of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt to the FTC, deliver copies of the Order to principals, officers, employees, and agents, and collect signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a sworn annual compliance report one year after issuance, and submit timely notices within 14 days of changes to contact information, corporate structure, or bankruptcy filings; all submissions must be sworn under penalty of perjury and sent to the designated FTC address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified records for 15 years after issuance (retaining each for 5 years), covering financials, personnel, consumer complaints, compliance documentation, marketing materials, testing records, law enforcement communications, and evidence of non-compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports and records within 10 days, communicating directly with and interviewing affiliated personnel, and using all other lawful means including undercover inquiries.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC website and terminates 20 years from its issuance date, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation — whichever is later — subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Use of Facial Recognition or Analysis Systems Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondents are banned from using facial recognition technology in retail stores, pharmacies, or online platforms for five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Deletion of Covered Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all photos and videos collected from facial recognition systems and notify third parties to do the same.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Mandated Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System Monitoring Program
provisions.summary: Before using any biometric surveillance system, Respondents must establish a comprehensive monitoring program to assess and mitigate risks of harm to consumers, including discriminatory impacts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Mandatory Notice and Complaint Procedures for Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide written notice to consumers enrolled in biometric galleries or affected by system outputs, and establish complaint procedures with required response times.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Required Retention Limits for Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Respondents must develop written retention schedules for biometric information with deletion timeframes no greater than 5 years unless required by law or with consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Disclosure of Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Respondents must post Clear and Conspicuous notices disclosing use of biometric surveillance systems in all locations where they are deployed.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must obtain signed acknowledgments of the Order from all relevant personnel and entities for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit annual compliance reports and timely notices of any structural changes or bankruptcy proceedings.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must create and retain records for 20 years documenting compliance with all provisions of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC has authority to monitor compliance through requests for reports, depositions, document production, and interviews.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Order supersedes the 2010 Decision and Order previously issued against Rite Aid.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates 20 years from issuance or from the most recent complaint filing, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Use of Facial Recognition or Analysis Systems Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondents are prohibited for five years from deploying or using any Facial Recognition or Analysis System in any retail store, retail pharmacy, or online retail platform.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Deletion of Covered Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all consumer photos and videos used with facial recognition systems within 45 days, notifythird parties and instruct them to delete within 60 days, and forward third-party deletion confirmations within 10 days of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Mandated Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System Monitoring Program
provisions.summary: Before using any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive monitoring Program that identifies and addresses consumer risks, including disproportionate impacts by race, ethnicity, gender, sex, age, or disability.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Mandatory Notice and Complaint Procedures for Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Before using any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must establish and maintain procedures providing consumers with notice of Gallery enrollment and Output-based actions, and a process for submitting and responding to complaints.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Required Retention Limits for Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Before implementing any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must develop and implement a written retention schedule for each type of consumer Biometric Information, setting out purposes, a deletion timeframe of no greater than five years, and the basis for that timeframe.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Disclosure of Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of the effective date, Respondents must post Clear and Conspicuous notices in each retail location and on each website/app/online service disclosing their use of Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems, including types of biometric data collected, outputs generated, purposes, and deletion timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to all principals, officers, directors, subsidiaries, and relevant employees, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit annual compliance reports, compliance notices within 14 days of changes in contact information or corporate structure, and bankruptcy filing notices within 14 days of filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must create certain records for 20 years after issuance and retain each for five years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, compliance records, System Assessment materials, security representations, Assessor materials, law enforcement subpoenas, and noncompliance records.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance through requests for reports and records, depositions, discovery, direct communications, interviews, and undercover methods, with Respondents obligated to respond within 14 days of written requests.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Decision and Order supersedes and replaces the Commission's 2010 Decision and Order in In re Rite Aid Corporation, C-4308.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, with specified exceptions for individual provisions, non-defendant respondents, and dismissed complaints.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Notice and Affirmative Express Consent Provision
provisions.summary: Before using Biometric Information collected from a User to create a Face Embedding or train/develop/alter any face recognition model or algorithm, Respondent must clearly disclose all purposes for which it will use the information and obtain affirmative express consent from the User.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Deletion
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete or destroy photos, videos, Face Embeddings, and Affected Work Product collected from certain Users within specified timeframes after the Order's issuance, and provide sworn written statements to the Commission confirming such deletion.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Use of Facial Recognition or Analysis Systems Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondents are prohibited for five years from deploying or using any Facial Recognition or Analysis System in any retail store, retail pharmacy, or online retail platform.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Deletion of Covered Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all photos, videos, and derived data used in connection with Facial Recognition or Analysis Systems prior to the order's effective date, notify third parties to do the same, and provide written confirmations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Mandated Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System Monitoring Program
provisions.summary: Before using any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System (other than prohibited facial recognition), Respondents must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive Monitoring Program to identify and address consumer risks, including risks of disproportionate harm based on race, ethnicity, gender, sex, age, or disability.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Mandatory Notice and Complaint Procedures for Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Before using any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must establish and maintain procedures to provide consumers with notice of Gallery enrollment and of adverse actions taken based on Outputs, and must investigate and respond to consumer complaints within specified timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Required Retention Limits for Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Prior to implementing any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must develop and implement a written retention schedule for each type of consumer Biometric Information collected, specifying purposes, a deletion timeframe of no more than five years, and the basis for that timeframe.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Disclosure of Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of the effective date, Respondents must post Clear and Conspicuous notices in each physical retail location and on each website, mobile application, or online service disclosing the use of any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, including types of Biometric Information collected, types of Outputs generated, purposes for use, and retention timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)
